history.content: I’m taking those 3, plus 61B, and I think in your case shouldn’t be too bad workload-wise.

children.subject:
What are your prior experiences regarding heavy workload semesters? That context may inform this decision. 

For my context, I took 61C + 70 together (with 2 light classes) and it was incredibly rough, as both classes have extremely heavy workloads and often had due dates overlap. 

I took Data100 with 3 other techs, and I survived but only barely and used a lot of past experience with Data100. 

Stat140 I took with 2 other techs and wasn't able to put as much time as I wanted into the course due to the sheer amount of work I had on my plate. 

A thing to consider is that Data100 and Stat140 are pretty fundamental courses for the path you seem to be on, and taking them with such a heavy load can prevent you from understanding all the nuances in each course in favor of rushing to get all of your assignments done each week. 

Of course, starting the semester with all 3 and seeing how the workload is (each class starts very quickly) for the first few weeks and then dropping one is always an option!

history.content:
On top of recruiting and  club activities (7-8 hours a week)

I'm debating whether to drop Stat 140 for something less heavy (and if so, does anyone have any recs) if I want to focus on recruiting this semester?
history.subject: How doable is 61C + Data 100 + Stat 140?
